page.title: 14Roads of Arden
page.content: The A82 is the main road in Arden. Two smaller roads lead off it, the B831 and the B832. They both meet at the Cross Keys. The A82 is a trunk road. It was built about 1746 by Major Caulfield because the Jacobites were causing trouble. The A82 is a twisty road. It has very nice scenery, cottages and farms. In a few years time it is going to be widened and straightened because it is too narrow and twisty for the big lorries, coaches and holiday traffic. The Glen Fruin road is a narrow road with passing places. There is a local service bus which runs along the A82 from the Vale of Leven to Luss and back six times a day.There are also three long distance buses which each run three times a day in both directions.
